titlestmt.titleproper: San Antonio Trip log book, Inclusive: 1941

note.p: Â© 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: One log book of an automobile trip from California to Texas in 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The San Antonio Trip log book includes commentary and notes about an automobile trip from California to Texas. The number and names of the people on the trip, other than two female names, Rose and June, are not known.

The unknown writer pens a lively commentary on various towns, historic sites, events, and people they met along the way. Texas places mentioned include El Paso, Pecos, Fort Stockton, San Antonio, the Alamo, Austin, Georgetown, Wichita Falls, Fort Worth, Amarillo, and the J.A. Ranch.

It seemed the goal of the trip for the people on it was San Antonio, as they stayed some days there. Most other towns they just passed through, and had less to say than at major stops. The J.R. Ranch was another multi-day stop, as Rose had an uncle, William Ward, that worked there.
The travel book abruptly ends as the group was passing through the Texas Pandhandle. It is not known if they were going back to California or if they were going somewhere else as part of their trip.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The San Antonio Trip log book consists of one item, the travel log, organized chronologically. Currently, the collections contains one series: I. Notebook.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: San Antonio Trip log book, Accession #569, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Paul T. Fisher. Released on 2020-02-03.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series includes a travel diary with notes and commentary from a California to Texas automobile trip. This series is in good condition.
